title:
On second-order variational analysis of variational convexity of
  prox-regular functions
abstract:
Variational convexity, together with ist strong counterpart, of
extended-real-valued functions has been recently introduced by Rockafellar. In
this paper we present second-order characterizations of these properties, i.e.,
conditions using first-order generalized derivatives of the subgradient
mapping. Up to now, such characterizations are only known under the assumptions
of prox-regularity and subdifferential continuity and in this paper we discard
the latter. To this aim we slightly modify the definitions of the generalized
derivatives to be compatible with the $f$-attentive convergence appearing in
the definition of subgradients. We formulate our results in terms of both
coderivatives and subspace containing derivatives. We also give formulas for
the exact bound of variational convexity and study relations between
variational strong convexity and tilt-stable local minimizers.
